This is a default schedule that runs every 15 minutes indefinitely to export trend samples from the current time back to the last known exported sample. Runs at 0, 15, 30, 45 minutes after the hour.
This is a default schedule that runs on user demand to export trend samples from the current time back to the last known exported sample.
This is a default schedule that never runs and means that a schedule should likely be assigned or run only on demand.

The first step on your journey to managing energy usage is creating building definitions. Here you will provide the name, address, type, size, and location of your energy managed buildings. Add as many buildings as you want for more energy efficiency.

Once you have one or more buildings defined, it is time to pair energy trend sources with EnergyReports™ 'meters'. This involves selecting your data sources, specifying a building and a few data properties, and enabling continuous data export.

Set it and forget it! Once your building and meter pairing activities are complete, this application gets to work over the long haul exporting data on regular intervals as it becomes available in your BMS trend database. Come here first if data goes missing.

This is where your energy data meets the award winning EnergyReports™ energy management and analysis cloud platform. Use this tool to select trended energy data, securely and continuously export that data into EnergyReports™ meters, and use that data to create sophisticated reports, charts, and other cost saving analysis tools.
